author: protolambda
content: <@!340345049063882753> We recently opened this chat for discv5 questions, sharing progress in interop, and implementation issues. If you're working on discv5 interop, let us know what you need, and we'll try to help.

author: ajsutton
content: awesome, thanks for the invite.

author: ajsutton
content: So to give an update, the discv5 implementation from Harmony has been poked and prodded a bit to become https://github.com/PegaSysEng/discovery and there's a PR open to integrate that into Teku.  I've also spent some time today investigating the discv5 implementation from Tuweni and have done a quick and dirty integration of it into Teku.  Both are able to do a handshake with Lighthouse running locally properly.  I seem to have done something bad to my local Lighthouse nodes and they aren't connecting to each other anymore, so not sure if discovery is actually working with the integration.

author: ajsutton
content: I'm having some trouble getting rumor installed.  On both MacOS and the `golang` docker image `go get -u github.com/protolambda/rumor` fails with:

author: ajsutton
content:
```rc/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/gossipsub.go:437:11: log.EventBegin undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method EventBegin)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:407:8: log.Warning undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method Warning)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:412:8: log.Warning undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method Warning)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:426:8: log.Warning undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method Warning)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:432:8: log.Warning undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method Warning)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:454:8: log.Warning undefined (type *log.ZapEventLogger has no field or method Warning)
src/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-pubsub/pubsub.go:454:8: too many errors```

author: protolambda
content: I'm using logrus, not zap. That's weird

author: ajsutton
content: Yeah, it looks like go-libp2p-pubsub is failing to install and it hasn't even gotten to rumor yet.

author: protolambda
content: It should just work, no zap required by rumor, and I doubt pubsub uses it. Try `go get -u ./...` (three dots for full package traversal)

author: protolambda
content: After git cloning it

author: protolambda
content: On mobile now, will try on laptop in a minute

author: ajsutton
content:
`go get -u ./...` gave: ```# github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-kad-dht
../pkg/mod/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-kad-dht@v0.5.0/dht.go:157:5: assignment mismatch: 1 variable but kbucket.NewRoutingTable returns 2 values
../pkg/mod/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-kad-dht@v0.5.0/dht.go:341:18: dht.routingTable.Update undefined (type *kbucket.RoutingTable has no field or method Update)
../pkg/mod/github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-kad-dht@v0.5.0/notif.go:111:18: dht.routingTable.Remove undefined (type *kbucket.RoutingTable has no field or method Remove)
```

author: protolambda
content: Ok, looks like ipfs logger uses zap in the back

author: ajsutton
content: Sounds like I should probably go talk to them.

author: protolambda
content: Maybe try fresh without the u flag, think that forced an incompatible update

author: ajsutton
content: Trying that now.  Just grabbed the ENR for Lighthouse's testnet from the readme and gave it a try.  Discovering tons of peers which is awesome to see.

author: ajsutton
content: No luck with the go get though.  I'll go ask the go-libp2p crowd and see if they know something.

author: protolambda
content: Oh, also: git clone and local running might be required, as the rumor go module uses a replace directive to use the go-ethereum fork of <@!194432762315407360> (where the latest dv5 work is, the geth master branch is out of date)

author: protolambda
content: managed to reproduce with `-u`, works without. I'll see if I can pin some indirect dependency versions to fix that. Shouldn't happen with minor go-libp2p updates though.

author: ajsutton
content: https://github.com/golang/go/issues/34189 looks somewhat relevant.  Apparently the latest version of libp2p is reported wrong.

author: protolambda
content: Found the issue, adding `go.sum` so you always have the correct deps

author: protolambda
content: I generally like omitting it, to find this kind of stuff in experimental software. `go-libp2p-kbucket` was updated, and just broke in combination with master v0.5 kad-dht. Oh well.

author: protolambda
content: Fixed it, install instructions in readme

author: ajsutton
content: Yep, that's working now.  Thanks.

author: protolambda
content: well, have fun with the REPL, it has a lot of networking commands, so you're bound to break either the REPL or a client if you experiment enough

author: protolambda
content: On a slightly related note, <@!194432762315407360> let me know what the status is on the different geth discovery v5 branches. I would love to just use upstream master branch to pull in dv5.

author: zahary.
content: I've played with Lighthouse's bootstrap nodes as well, but we have plenty of code changes since then. Will be happy to do another test soon

author: zahary.
content:
We've migrated our entire bootstrap process to ENR records, so we are now publishing ENR URIs in the testnet metadata files:

https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-testnets/blob/master/nimbus/testnet1/bootstrap_nodes.txt
